bibl.title: The Shrine in the praesidium of Dios (Eastern Desert of Egypt): Graffiti and Oracles in Context.
bibl.note: Excavations conducted by the author and financed by the French Foreign Office and the IFAO, 2005-2009. - I. Introduction. [1 = Inv. 262. Latin dedication, 114/115.] - II. Phasing and short archaeological description of the aedes. - III. Two inscriptions from the primitive aedes? [2 = Inv. 261. Greek dedication by an architect, 2nd cent.; - 3 = Inv. 658. Latin inscription, with rasura, post 235?] - IV. Greek and Latin graffiti from the aedes [4 = Inv. 1067, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 5-7 = Inv. 1087, 2nd cent.; - 8 = Inv. 1070, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 9-10 = Inv. 1068, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 11 = Inv. 1593, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 12 = Inv. 1069, post 212; - 13. = Inv. 1065, 4-5th cent.] - V. The [Greek] ostraca from the filling of the podium [14 = Inv. 1005; - 15-23. The oracular responses, ca. 200: a. The texts; - b. Diplomatic; - c. The epigraphic parallels and the contents of the prophecies; d. An unsolved problem: the mechanism of inquiry at Dios; - e. Papyrological parallels; - f. Conclusion.] - VI. General conclusion: once more Zeus Helios Megas Sarapis.
bibl.seg: CUVIGNY Hélène, The Shrine in the praesidium of Dios (Eastern Desert of Egypt): Graffiti and Oracles in Context.

Excavations conducted by the author and financed by the French Foreign Office and the IFAO, 2005-2009. - I. Introduction. [1 = Inv. 262. Latin dedication, 114/115.] - II. Phasing and short archaeological description of the aedes. - III. Two inscriptions from the primitive aedes? [2 = Inv. 261. Greek dedication by an architect, 2nd cent.; - 3 = Inv. 658. Latin inscription, with rasura, post 235?] - IV. Greek and Latin graffiti from the aedes [4 = Inv. 1067, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 5-7 = Inv. 1087, 2nd cent.; - 8 = Inv. 1070, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 9-10 = Inv. 1068, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 11 = Inv. 1593, 2nd cent. - ca. 250; - 12 = Inv. 1069, post 212; - 13. = Inv. 1065, 4-5th cent.] - V. The [Greek] ostraca from the filling of the podium [14 = Inv. 1005; - 15-23. The oracular responses, ca. 200: a. The texts; - b. Diplomatic; - c. The epigraphic parallels and the contents of the prophecies; d. An unsolved problem: the mechanism of inquiry at Dios; - e. Papyrological parallels; - f. Conclusion.] - VI. General conclusion: once more Zeus Helios Megas Sarapis.
